analytic.title: The Origin of the Lamentationes gloriosissimae Virginis Mariae super Passione Domini of Ephraem the Syrian

monogr.title: Copyists, Collectors, Redactors and Editors: Manuscripts and Editions of Late Byzantine and Early Modern Greek Literature. Papers Given at a Conference Held at the Danish Institute at Athens, 23-26 May 2002, in Honour of Hans Eideneier and Arnold van Gemert

body.bibl: Bakker, Wim F. “The Origin of the Lamentationes Gloriosissimae Virginis Mariae Super Passione Domini of Ephraem the Syrian.” In Copyists, Collectors, Redactors and Editors: Manuscripts and Editions of Late Byzantine and Early Modern Greek Literature. Papers Given at a Conference Held at the Danish Institute at Athens, 23-26 May 2002, in Honour of Hans Eideneier and Arnold van Gemert, edited by David Holton, Tina Lendari, Ulrich Moennig, and Peter Vejleskov, 401–22. Herakleion: Crete University Press, 2005.

Bakker, The Origin of the Lamentationes Gloriosissimae Virginis Mariae Super Passione Domini of Ephraem the Syrian,” in Copyists, Collectors, Redactors and Editors: Manuscripts and Editions of Late Byzantine and Early Modern Greek Literature.
